name: lukshef-ax1
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3
body: |- wnan(wnan(w0, wnan(w1, w2)), wnan(wnan(w3, wnan(w3, w3)), wnan(wnan(w3, w1), wnan(wnan(w0, w3), wnan(w0, w3)))))

body.origin: |- wnan(wnan(w0, wnan(w1, w2)), wnan(wnan(w3, wnan(w3, w3)), wnan(wnan(w3, w1), wnan(wnan(w0, w3), wnan(w0, w3)))))

cumulated.origin: |- wnan(wnan(w0, wnan(w1, w2)), wnan(wnan(w3, wnan(w3, w3)), wnan(wnan(w3, w1), wnan(wnan(w0, w3), wnan(w0, w3)))))

comment: This alternative axiom for propositional calculus using the Sheffer Stroke was discovered by Lukasiewicz in his Selected Works. It improves on Nicod's axiom by reducing its number of variables by one. This axiom also uses ~ nic-mp for its constructions. Here, the axiom is proved as a substitution instance of ~ nic-ax . (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 31-Jul-2011.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
